title: More Than 60,000 Interpreters, Visa Applicants Remain in Afghanistan
sub_head: About 33,000 of those could be eligible for immediate evacuation, State Department says
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”More than 60,000 Afghan interpreters and others who have applied for asylum in the U.S. after working alongside American forces still remain in Afghanistan, a State Department official said Thursday.
About 33,000 Afghans, including principal applicants and their families, have already cleared the more-onerous vetting requirements and could be eligible for immediate evacuation. This is the first time that the State Department has provided a number on those left behind since the Afghanistan government collapsed this summer.
